t: Sudden Brand Name REMOVED from Brand Registry
s: We are a long time loyal Amazon seller, but we just got an emailed this morning from Brand Registry case id 13757205111 stating our brand was removed from brand registry without detail explanation, and we dont know what happened/caused the removal. Upon checking with our laywer, it happened ...

t: My brand has been removed by Amazon
s: My brand has been removed by Amazon for nearly three months, during which time I have submitted a POA and passed the brand video review. However, so far Amazon has not restored my brand and deleted a listing under that brand, which has brought great risks and losses to my operations.

t: Our brand has been removed from the ...
s: Our brand has been registered for a long time, but it was suddenly removed from Amazon Brand Registry by Amazon on 6/21/2023.

t: Brand Removed from brand Registry
s: Hello from Amazon Brand Registry, We are writing to inform you that your brand *********** has been removed from Amazon Brand Registry.

t: Your brand has been removed from Brand Registry
s: We are currently facing a significant challenge regarding our brand's status on Amazon. Despite being the sole owner and never authorizing anyone else to use our exclusive brand, it has been removed from our account.

t: Account “Brand” is removed from Brand Registry.
s: Hi @Seller_7CxAzUHpgPmb5if you believe your brand was removed in error (in other words, you did not take the actions outlined as in violation), you can submit a case to appeal for reinstatement.

t: Brand Name was removed from Brand Registry program!
s: Our brand name was removed from Brand Registry program by brand registry team last week. The message said our access to the Brand Registry was revoked due to the actions we have taken in direct violation of Amazon’s Brand Registry policies. Below is the message we received.

t: Requirements and tips for enrolling a brand in Amazon Brand Registry - Sell on Amazon
s: June 4, 2024 - Permanently affixed brand names are typically applied during production using methods like printing, sewing, laser etching, or engraving. Stickers, labels, stamps, and tags are not considered permanent since they can be easily added or removed after production.
